data.message: I love FB also but  I would like to know how to keep all the political stuff from repeating on my page.   I just want to hear from friend and a few other sites that I have selected like recipes, etc.  This is ruining FB for me.

replies.message: Hi Barbara. We're sorry to hear that you're seeing things you don't like. To stop seeing stories from a particular person or Page, click the arrow in the top right of the story and select Unfollow. This will prevent you seeing stories from this person or Page in future.  For more information, visit our Help Center at: http://on.fb.me/1o7HHs4. -Chantal
when I saw Charlie and Alia on the same comments I realized how varied and many friends I have made in my 89 years.  All outstanding and community minded people with strong dedication to their work.
it is your likes and interest check those and thin those down

In the upper right hand corner of each posting there is a drop down arrow.  If you click on it, it should ask you if you want to delete the posting. I believe it may ask you why, but you still get to have the ones you don't want to be removed.  Hope this helps.  :-)

I see way, way, way too many news feed items again and again, when people add more comments. I want a default to see a posting ONCE! ! !  And I don't want a default of top stories. I want to see everything new that's getting posted by my 302 friends and my hundreds of Likes. Let me control things in MY feed, not the uber-controlling Facebook that thinks it knows better than me. Very, very irritating! (I want Facebook to help me to see new items from family in many states in the U.S. and friends around the world. That's my highest priority, by far.)
Barb get off Facebook and write letters  or call your friends you twit
Nobody cares Beth stop acting like spoiled children

Beth, get an email address, it might help if you wrote to your family and friends while not on Facebook. Ya know, how things were prior to Facebook coming on line?
It isn't so bad......
